author: Staff Reporter
text:
Over 82,000 children less than five years old are expected to be vaccinated in the special polio camps to be held in the corporation limits on January 17, and February 21.

Corporation Commissioner K.R. Selvaraj said that 196 centres would be established across the city to administer polio drops to children.

Centres would function at the Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital, Primary Health Centres in the city, corporation dispensaries, health offices, ICDS centres, schools, Old Bus Stand, New Bus Stand, railway station and other public places.

Special teams would visit slums, and migrant workers staying along roadsides, to administer vaccine to their children. Mr. Selvaraj said that one lakh doses of polio vaccine had been stored. The vaccine would be administered between 7 a.m. and 5 p.m.
title: Vaccination camp on January 17
